description.p: The invention relates to a motorcycle comprising a body frame and an engine mounted to the body frame.

In a motorcycle, in view of improvement in engine supporting rigidity of a body frame, an engine is mounted in a space enclosed by left and right tank rails and left and right down tubes and fixed to the left and right tank rails and the left and right down tubes through a separate bracket, for example, in some case (refer to JP 2,903,231). However, such motorcycles are also known from JP 3231089 and JP 4212685. The closest prior art is represented by document JP5050969 which describes a motorcycle including a body frame and an engine mounted to the body frame, wherein the body frame comprises left and right frame members provided on one and the other side in the vehicle width direction, a cross member for connecting the left and right frame members with each other, and a bracket comprising left and right brackets, wherein a boss part of a cylinder part of the enginewhich is placed in the vicinity of a top end of the cylinder part of the engine, is provided between the left and right brackets and is mounted directly to the left and right brackets by means of a fastening bolt.

In the conventional motorcycle, the left and right tank rails and the left and right down tubes are used for supporting an engine. This causes a problem that the number of components and the weight of the vehicle body increase although the supporting rigidity can be secured.

In order to solve such a problem, considered can be removing the down tubes. In the case that the down tubes are removed in a structure such as the conventional structure in which the left and right tank rails support the engine through the separate bracket, however, the rigidity in supporting the engine is likely to be deteriorated.

In view of the above, an object of the invention is to provide a motorcycle capable of reducing the number of components and the weight of the vehicle body in addition to achieving the necessary rigidity in supporting an engine.
description.heading: [Means for Solving the Problems]
description.p: The invention is motorcycle according to claim 1.

In the invention, the cylinder part is a collective term for a cylinder block, a cylinder head and a head cover. Further, integrating a bracket with a cross member means forming a bracket into one body with a cross member by welding, casting, pressing, forging or the like.

In accordance with the motorcycle according to the invention, a bracket is integrated with a cross member for connecting left and right frame members and a cylinder part of an engine is directly mounted to the bracket, so that a body frame directly supports an upper part of the engine and the necessary rigidity in supporting the engine can be secured. This allows down tubes to be removed, and thereby, the number of components and the weight of the vehicle body to be reduced. Due to a more compact assembly bending moments can be reduced and supporting rigidity improved.

description.p: An embodiment of the invention will be described hereinafter on the basis of the attached drawings.

Figs. 1 to 7 illustrate a motorcycle in accordance with an embodiment of the invention. The front, rear, left and right in the embodiment means the front, rear, left and right in a person's view, the person being sitting on a seat. The upper and lower parts in the embodiment means the upper and lower parts in a direction vertical to a road surface.

In the drawings, 1 denotes a body frame of a motorcycle. The body frame 1 comprises a head pipe 2, left and right tank rails (frame members) 3 and 3 extending obliquely downward from the head pipe 2 toward the rear of the vehicle, rear arm brackets 4 and 4 extending downward following to the rear ends of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3, left and right seat rails 5 and 5 extending obliquely upward from the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 toward the rear of the vehicle and left and right seat stays 6 and 6 bridged between the rear parts of the left and right seat rails 5 and 5 and the left and right rear arm bracket 4 and 4.

The head pipe 2 holds a front fork 7 so that the front fork 7 can be steered left and right. A front wheel 8 is rotatably held at the lower end of the front fork 7. A steering handle 9 is mounted on the upper end. A headlight 15 is provided on the front side of the head pipe 2. A meter device 16 such as a speedometer is provided at the upper part of the headlight 15.
The left and right rear arm brackets 4 hold the front end part of a rear arm 10 so that the rear arm 10 can vertically swing. The rear end part of the rear arm 10 rotatably holds the rear wheel 11.
A fuel tank 12 is mounted on the left and right tank rails 3 and 3. A double seat 13 is mounted on the left and right seat rails 5 and 5.

A water-cooling type engine 20 is mounted under the left and right tank rails 3 and 3. The engine 20 has a structure that a cylinder block 23, a cylinder head 24 and head cover 25 are piled on the upper mating surface of a crank case 22 in which the crank shaft 21 is housed and a bolt is fastened in the piled components for connection.

A transmission case 22a for having a change gear (not shown) built in is formed into one body with the crank case 22 at the rear part of the crank case 22. It is arranged that the rear wheel 11 be driven for rotation through a chain 26a by means of a drive shaft 26 provided on the rear part of the transmission case 22.

A front wall part of the cylinder head 24 is connected to an exhaust pipe 27. The exhaust pipe 27 extends downward from the front wall part to pass under the engine 20 toward the rear part of the vehicle. The exhaust pipe 27 is connected to a muffler 28 provided on the right side of the rear wheel 11.
A rear wall part of the cylinder head 24 is connected to an intake pipe 29. The intake pipe 29 extends rearward under the fuel tank 12 to be connected to an air cleaner (not shown) .

A radiator 30 is provided on the upper-front part of the engine 20. Left and right upper wall parts of the radiator 30 are fixed to radiator brackets 32 and 32 mounted to the lower surface of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 by fastening a bolt. A lower end part on the left side is fixed to the cylinder head 24 through the arm bracket 31 by fastening a bolt.

The left and right seat rails 5 and 5 and the seat stays 6 and 6 are covered with left and right side covers 38 and 38 made of resin. The left and right side covers 38 are substantially in the shape of a reverse triangle in which a front edge 38a of the side cover 38 extends along the upper surface of the tank rail 3, an upper edge 38b extends along the lower edge parts of the fuel tank 12 and the seat 13 and a lower edge 38c extends along the seat stay 6 in a side view of the vehicle.

On the outer sides of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 of the vehicle, provided are front covers 40 and 40 made of resin. The left and right front covers 40 and 40 function as an air scoop for introducing running wind into the radiator 30.

The left and right tank rails 3 and 3 are formed from welded plural metal plates. The left and right tank rails 3 and 3 have a cross section in the shape of a rectangle whose dimension in the vertical direction is designed larger than the dimension of the vehicle width. The left and right tank rails 3 and 3 are formed so as to gradually become larger in dimension in the vertical direction from the rear side to the front side. The dimension of the height of the front end parts 3a of the left and right tank rails 3 in the vertical direction is arranged to be substantially equal to the dimension of the height of the head pipe 2 in the axial direction. This allows the strength in connection between the left and right tank rails 3 and the head pipe 2 and the rigidity to be improved, so that endurance against a large bending moment operating on the connecting part between the head pipe 2 and the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 can be achieved.

The left and right tank rails 3 and 3 include inside inclined parts 3b and 3b having an interval therebetween, the interval being widened in the vehicle width direction from the head pipe 2 toward the rear part of the vehicle in a plan view, and straight line parts 3c and 3c extending substantially straight from the rear ends of the inside inclined parts 3b and 3b to the rear part of the vehicle. The front end parts 3a of the left and right inside inclined parts 3b and 3b are welded to the head pipe 2 for bonding. An interior angle of the left and right inside inclined parts 3b and 3b is set at around 60 degrees.

On the upper and lower sides of the left and right inside inclined parts 3b and 3b, welded for bonding are upper and lower gussets 33 and 34 in the shape of a triangle in a plan view, the gussets functioning as a reinforcing member. The upper gusset 33 is a flat plate. The lower gusset 34 includes a flat bottom wall 34a and a vertical wall 34b rising upward from a rear edge of the bottom wall 34a. A resonator chamber for secondary air (not shown) is provided in a space enclosed by the head pipe 2 and the upper and lower gussets 33 and 34.

On inner wall surfaces of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3, provided is lateral gusset 35 functioning as a reinforcing member. The lateral gusset 35 is in the shape of a bar having a U-shaped horizontal cross-section. The lateral gusset 35 extends from the rear part of the inside inclined parts 3b of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 to the vicinity of the front end part of the straight part 3c in an axial direction of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 and in a direction away from the head pipe 2. Opening edges of the U-shaped lateral gusset 35 are welded on the inner wall surfaces of the tank rails 3. The front end part 35a is welded to the vertical wall 34b of the lower gusset 34 for bonding.

On a front side part of a middle cross member 51, which is provided between the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 and which is mentioned later, provided is a reservoir tank 36 for supplying the radiator 30 with cooling water. The reservoir tank 36 is arranged to be offset to the left with respect to a center line of the vehicle body C so as to be provided along the inside of the left tank rail 3 (refer to Fig. 7) . Removing a maintenance cover 39 detachably mounted to the side cover 38 allows the reservoir tank 36 to be supplied with cooling water (refer to Fig. 1).

The engine 20 is directly mounted to pairs of left and right front, middle and lower brackets 53, 54 and 55, which are provided into one body with cylindrical front, middle and lower cross members 50, 51 and 52 connecting the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 and the left and right rear arm brackets 4 and 4 and which are made of sheet metal. A detailed structure of the engine 20 is as follows.

The front cross member 50 is provided between the inner walls of the front end parts of the straight parts 3c and 3c of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3. Flange parts 50a and 50a formed on the left and right end parts of the front cross member 50 are welded to the inner walls for bonding. The flange parts 50a are located over the rear end part 35b of the lateral gusset 35. That is to say, the front cross member 50 and the lateral gusset 35 are provided within a dimension in the height direction of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 so as to be different in location in the height direction.

A pair of the left and right front brackets 53 and 53 is welded to the front cross member 50 into one body for bonding with predetermined intervals in the vehicle width direction. The left and right front brackets 53 and 53 are located within planes of shadows of the left and right tank rails 3 in a side view of the vehicle so as not to be in sight from the outside.

The left and right front brackets 53 and 53 include belt-shaped supporting parts 53b extending downward from the cross member 50 so as to be a little bit inclined rearward and front and rear flange parts 53c formed by bending outside in the vehicle width direction from the top end of the supporting part 53b. The flange parts 53c are welded to the front cross member 50. At the lower end part of the supporting part 53b, formed is a bolt hole 53a. The flange part 53c can be extended to the lower end part of the supporting part 53b, of course. Contrary to the above, it is also possible to adopt a structure of providing only the supporting part 53b without providing the flange parts 53c.
As shown in Fig. 4, an interval w1 between the left tank rail 3 and the front-left bracket 53 is set to be larger than an interval w2 between the right tank rail 3 and the supporting part 53b of the front-right bracket 53. In other words, the left and right front brackets 53 and 53 are arranged to be offset to the right in the vehicle width direction with respect to the center line of the vehicle body C. This allows efficiency in operation of mounting the engine 20 to the vehicle to be improved as described later.

The middle cross member 51 is provided between the inner walls of the top end parts of the left and right rear arm brackets 4 and 4. The flange parts 51a and 51a formed on the left and right end parts of the middle cross member 51 are bonded to the inner walls by welding.

The pair of left and right middle brackets 54 and 54 are bonded into one body with the middle cross member 51 with a predetermined intervals in the vehicle width direction by welding so as to be symmetrical with respect to the center line of the vehicle body C. The left and right middle brackets 54 and 54 include belt-shaped supporting parts 54b extending downward from the middle cross member 51 so as to be a little bit inclined frontward and flange parts 54c formed by bending outside in the vehicle width direction from the supporting parts. The top ends of the flange parts 54c are welded to the middle cross member 51 . At the lower end part of the supporting part 54b, formed is a bolt hole 54a. The bolt hole 54a is located at a forward part of a front edge part of the rear arm bracket 4 in a side view of the vehicle.

A lower cross member 52 is arranged between the inner walls of the lower end parts of the left and right rear arm brackets 4 and 4. At the left end part of the lower cross member 52, provided is a side stand bracket 56. A flange part 52a is formed on the right end bracket. The flange part 52a and the side stand bracket 56 are inserted at the lower end parts of the left and right rear arm brackets 4 and 4 to be welded for fixing. A pair of left and right lower brackets 55 and 55 is welded into one body with the lower cross member 52 for bonding with a predetermined interval in the vehicle width direction.

The left and right lower brackets 55 and 55 include suspension parts 55a projecting forward from the lower ends of the rear arm brackets 4 and center stand supporting parts 55b projecting downward. The left and right suspension parts 55a are provided with bolt holes 55c. The left and right lower brackets 55 and 55 are symmetrical with respect to the center line of the vehicle body C.

On the upper end part of a rear wall of the cylinder head 24, which is a component of the cylinder part of the engine 20, formed into one body is an upper boss part 24a projecting rearward. The upper boss part 24a and the rear end part of the head cover 25 are overlapped with the left and right tank rails 3 in a side view of the vehicle. The upper boss part 24a is provided with a bolt inserting hole 24b so that the bolt inserting hole 24b would be coaxial with the bolt holes 53a of the left and right front brackets 53.

The upper boss part 24a is arranged to be provided between the left and right front brackets 53 and 53. Inserting a fastening bolt 58 into the bolt hole 53a, the bolt inserting hole 24b and the bolt hole 53a from the left side of the vehicle and fastening a nut 58a allow the upper boss part 24a to be directly fixed to the left and right front brackets 53 and 53. A wide operating space, which is formed according to widening of the interval w1 between the left tank rail 3 and the front-left bracket 53, is used for inserting the fastening bolt 58 into the bolt hole 53a. This allows difficulty in efficiency in operation of mounting the engine 20 to be prevented from occurring while the front brackets 53 and 53 are overlapped with the left and right tank rails 3.

As described above, the left and right front brackets 53 and 53 and the upper boss part 24a are provided to be shifted to one side from the center line of the vehicle body C (the right side in the embodiment) while the engine 20 is mounted so that a cylinder axis C' thereof would be shifted by an amount of "d" to the right side from the center line of the vehicle body C. This is likely to deteriorate the balance in weight in the vehicle width direction (to make the right side heavier than the left side). Accordingly, in the embodiment, components of an engine and components mounted to the vehicle are provided to be shifted to the other side (the left side in the embodiment) from the center line of the vehicle C so as to improve the balance in weight in the vehicle width direction, as shown in Figs. 5 and 8 to 10.

Concretely, a cam shaft driving mechanism 21' and a cooling water pump 61, which are used as components of an engine, and an ignition coil 62 and a reservoir tank 36, which are used as components mounted to the vehicle, are provided so as to be shifted to the left side from the center line of the vehicle C.

The cam shaft driving mechanism 21' comprises a crank sprocket 21a formed at a left side part of the crank shaft 21, a cam sprocket 60a mounted to a left side part of the cam shaft 60 and a timing chain 21c wound around the both sprockets 60a and 21a. The cam shaft driving mechanism 21' is arranged to pass through chain rooms 24c and 23a formed at left side parts of the cylinder head 24 and the cylinder block 23.

The cooling water pump 61 comprises a pump case 61a mounted to a left side wall of the cylinder head 24, a pump cover 61b mounted to a left end opening of the case and an impeller 61c provided in the pump case 61a and the pump cover 61b. The impeller 61c is mounted at a left end of the cam shaft 60 coaxially with the cam sprocket 60a.

Cooling water for an engine is sucked from the radiator 30 into the cooling water pump 61 through an intake 61d to be supplied to a cooling jacket in the cylinder head 24, and then, further sent to the radiator 30 through a cooling water hose 61e to be sucked again into the cooling water pump 61.
The ignition coil 62 is detachably mounted to a bracket 53d fixed on the front side of the cross member.

On a rear wall of the transmission case 22a of the crank case 22, formed into one body is a middle boss part 22b projecting upward. The middle boss part 22b is arranged to be provided between the left and right middle brackets 54 and 54. The middle boss part 22b is provided with a bolt inserting hole 22d so that the bolt inserting hole 22d would be substantially coaxial with the bolt hole 54a. The middle boss part 22b is directly fixed to the left and right middle brackets 54 and 54 by means of the fastening bolt 59 inserted from the outside in the vehicle width direction.

At a lower end part of a rear wall of the transmission case 22a, formed into one body is a lower boss part 22c projecting rearward. The lower boss part 22c is arranged to be provided between the suspension parts 55a and 55a of the left and right lower brackets 55 and 55. The lower boss part 22c is provided with a bolt inserting hole 22e so that the bolt inserting hole 22e would be substantially coaxial with the bolt hole 55a. The lower boss part 22c is directly fixed to the left and right suspension parts 55a and 55a by means of a fastening bolt 60 inserted from the outside in the vehicle width direction.

The middle bracket 54 and the suspension part 55a of the lower bracket 55 are exposed outside from the rear arm bracket 4 in a side view of the vehicle. Accordingly, an operation of inserting the fastening bolts 59 and 60 can be easily performed.
As described above, in the engine 20, the upper end part, the middle part and the lower end part of the rear side wall of the engine 20 are directly fixed to the body frame 1, respectively.

In accordance with the invention, the front brackets 53 and 53 are welded into one body with the front cross member 50 connecting the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 to each other and the cylinder head 24 forming a cylinder part of the engine 20 is directly mounted to the front brackets 53 and 53. This allows the supporting rigidity necessary for the engine 20 to be secured.

In the embodiment, the upper part and the lower part of the crank case 22 of the engine 20 are directly mounted to the pair of left and right middle and lower brackets 54 and 55 provided into one body with the middle and lower cross members 51 and 52 connecting the left and right rear arm brackets 4 and 4 to each other. Accordingly, the supporting rigidity of a whole engine 20 can be secured. This allows a down tube to be omitted, and thereby, the number of components and the weigh of the vehicle body to be reduced.

In the embodiment, the upper end part of the cylinder head 24 forming the cylinder part is directly mounted to the body frame 1, so that the distance from a case suspension part can be large. This allows the supporting rigidity to be further improved.

The upper boss part 24a, which is to be mounted to the front bracket 53, is formed into one body with the cylinder head 24 to be overlapped with the left and right tank rails 3 in a side view of the vehicle. This allows the front bracket 53 to be short, so that the bending moment operating on the bracket can be smaller than the case that the front bracket is long. Further, the upper boss part 24a can be covered up by means of the tank rail 3, and thereby, a clear-cut appearance can be achieved.

In the embodiment, the interval w1 between the left tank rail 3 and the front-left bracket 53 is set to be larger than the interval w2 between the right tank rail 3 and the front-right bracket 53. This allows a space for operation in inserting the fastening bolt 58 into the upper boss part 24a overlapped with the tank rail 3 in the width direction to be secured.

Further, the balance in weight in the vehicle width direction is likely to be deteriorated (the right side is likely to be heavier) since the left and right front brackets 53 and 53 are provided so as to be shifted to the right side in the vehicle width direction from the center line of the vehicle body C in the embodiment. The balance in weight, however, can be improved by means of the cam shaft driving mechanism 21' and the cooling water pump 61, which are used as components of an engine, provided so as to be shifted to the left side in the vehicle width direction from the center line of the vehicle body C. In this case, the cooling water pump 61 is arranged to be provided at the left end part of the cam shaft 60 and outside the cam sprocket 60a. Accordingly, the cooling water pump 61 is shifted largely to the left side, so that it greatly contributes to improvement in balance in weight.

Moreover, an ignition coil 62 and the reservoir tank 36 are provided so as to be shifted to the left side from the center line of the vehicle body C. This also allows the balance in weight to be improved.

Moreover, the lateral gusset 35 is fixed to the inner wall surfaces of the left and right tank rails 3 and 3 and parts of the tank rails 3, which have the rigidity improved by means of the lateral gusset 35, are connected to each other by means of the front cross member 50. In view of this point, the supporting rigidity of the engine can be also improved.

In addition, the lateral gusset 35 and the front cross member 50 are arranged within a dimension of the height of the tank rail 3 so as to be different in location in vertical direction. Accordingly, providing the lateral gusset 35 does not cause a complicated connecting structure of the front cross member 50.

In the embodiment, described is a case that the cylinder head 24, which forms a component of the cylinder part, is directly mounted to the body frame 1. In the invention, however, the cylinder block 23 or the head cover 25, which is another component of the cylinder part, may be directly mounted to the body frame 1. Further, the side wall of the cylinder part may be directly mounted to the body frame although the rear wall of the cylinder part is mounted to the body frame in the embodiment. Moreover, the boss part may be provided outside one or two brackets, of course, although the upper boss part 24a is provided between the left and right brackets 53 and 53.

In the embodiment, described is a case that the cooling water pump is provided coaxially at the other side end of the cam shaft. The cooling water pump in the invention, however, may be provided in a place other than the above, in a crank case, for example, of course.

claim.claim-text: Motorrad mit einem Fahrzeugrahmen (1) und einem wassergekühlten Motor (20), der an dem Fahrzeugrahmen (1) befestigt ist, wobei der Fahrzeugrahmen (1) umfasst: linke und rechte Rahmenelemente (3, 3), die auf der einen und auf der anderen Seite in der Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite vorgesehen sind; einen Querträger (50) zum Verbinden der linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) miteinander; und eine Halterung (53), die einstückig mit dem Querträger (50) vorgesehen ist, wobei die Halterung (53) linke und rechte Halterungen (53, 53) aufweist, wobei ein Nabenteil (24a) eines Zylinderteils (24) des Motors (20) direkt an der Halterung (53) angebracht ist, und wobei das Nabenteil (24a) in der Nähe eines oberen Endes des Zylinderteils (24) ist, das Nabenteil (24a) des Zylinderteils (24) überlappt sich mit den linken und rechten Rahmenelementen (3, 3) in einer Seitenansicht des Motorrades und der überlappende Teil ist direkt an der Halterung (53) angebracht, das Nabenteil (24a) des Zylinderteils (24) des Motors (20) und die linken und rechten Halterungen (53, 53) werden zusammengehalten durch eine Befestigungsschraube (58), die in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite an einer Stelle eingesetzt wird, die sich mit den linken und rechten Rahmenelementen (3, 3) in der Seitenansicht des Motorrades überlappt, wobei die linken und die rechten Halterungen (53, 53) jeweils einstückig mit dem Querträger (50) mit einem Abstand zueinander in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite vorgesehen sind, wobei das Nabenteil (24a) des Zylinderteils (24) des Motors (20) zwischen der linken und rechten Halterung (53, 53) vorgesehen ist und direkt an der linken und rechten Halterung (53, 53) angebracht ist, wobei sich ein Abstand (w1) zwischen dem linken Rahmenteil (3) und der linken Halterung (53) unterscheidet von einem Abstand (w2) zwischen dem rechten Rahmenteil (3) und der rechten Halterung (53).

Motorrad nach Anspruch 1, wobei die linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) nach innen geneigte Teile (3b, 3b) aufweisen, die zur Unterstützung einer Vordergabel (7) mit einem Lenkkopf (2) verschweißt sind,
die geneigten Teile (3b, 3b) einen Abstand zueinander haben, wobei der Abstand in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite vom Lenkkopf (2) ausgehend in Richtung eines hinteren Teils des Fahrzeugs in einer Draufsicht gesehen zunimmt,
und sich geradlinige Teile (3c, 3c) im Wesentlichen geradlinig von hinteren Enden der nach innen geneigten Teile (3b, 3b) zum hinteren Teil des Fahrzeugs erstrecken,
die linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) mit linken und rechen Verstärkungselementen (35, 35) vorgesehen sind,
wobei sich die linken und rechten Verstärkungselemente (35, 35) von hinteren Teilen der nach innen geneigten Teile (3b, 3b) der linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) bis in die Nähe von vorderen Endteilen der geradlinigen Teile (3c, 3c) in eine axiale Richtung der linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) und vom Lenkkopf (2) weggerichtet erstrecken, und der Querträger (50) Teile der linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) in der Nähe der Verstärkungselemente (35, 35) miteinander verbindet.

Motorrad nach Anspruch 2, wobei der Querträger (50) und eine Versteifung (35, 35), die das Verstärkungselement bildet, innerhalb einer Abmessung in Richtung der Höhe der linken und rechten Rahmenelemente (3, 3) ausgebildet sind, und an unterschiedlichen Stellen in Richtung der Höhe vorgesehen sind.

Motorrad nach einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, wobei der Motor (20) an der Halterung (53) befestigt ist, so dass eine Zylinderachse auf eine Seite in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite von einer Mittellinie eines Fahrzeugkörpers versetzt ist und mindestens ein Teil einer Komponente des Motors (20) oder eine Komponente, die am Motorrad angebracht ist, auf der anderen Seite ist.

Motorrad nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Komponente des Motors (20) ein Nockenwellenantrieb (21') ist, der umfasst: ein seitlichen Kurbelwellen-Kettenrad (21 a) und ein seitliches Nockenwellen-Kettenrad (60a), wobei das seitliche Kurbelwellen-Kettenrad (21 a) und ein seitliches Nockenwellen-Kettenrad (60a) auf der anderen Seite in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite in Bezug auf die Mittellinie des Fahrzeugkörpers vorgesehen sind, und eine Kette (21c), die um das seitliche Nockenwellen-Kettenrad (60a) und das seitliche Kurbelwellen-Kettenrad (21 a) gelegt ist, wobei der Nockenwellenantrieb (21') derart vorgesehen ist, dass dieser einen Kettenraum (23a, 24c), der auf der anderen Seite des Motors (20) ausgebildet ist, durchläuft.

Motorrad nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Komponente des Motors (20) eine Kühlwasserpumpe (61) ist, die auf der anderen Seite in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite in Bezug auf die Mittellinie des Fahrzeugkörpers vorgesehen ist.
Motorrad nach Anspruch 6, wobei die Kühlwasserpumpe (61) koaxial zu einer Nockenwelle (60) an dem anderen Ende der Nockenwelle (60) vorgesehen ist.

Motorrad nach Anspruch 4, wobei die Komponente, die an dem Motorrad angebracht ist, eine Zündspule (62) ist, die mit einer Spulenhalterung (53d), die an dem Querträger (50 vorgesehen ist, angebracht ist, so dass diese auf die andere Seite in Richtung der Fahrzeugbreite von einer Mittellinie eines Fahrzeugkörpers versetzt ist.

Motorcycle including a body frame (1) and a water cooled engine (20) mounted to the body frame (1), wherein the body frame (1) comprises: left and right frame members (3, 3) provided on one and the other side in the vehicle width direction; a cross member (50) for connecting the left and right frame members (3, 3) with each other; and a bracket (53) provided into one body with the cross member (50), wherein the bracket comprises left and right brackets (53, 53), wherein a boss part (24a) of a cylinder part (24) of the engine (20) is directly mounted to the bracket (53), and wherein the boss part (24a) is in the vicinity of a top end of the cylinder part (24),
the boss part (24a) of the cylinder part (24) is overlapped with the left and right frame members (3, 3) in a side view of the motorcycle and the overlapped part is directly mounted to the bracket (53), the boss part (24a) of the cylinder part (24) of the engine (20) and the left and right brackets (53, 53) are fitted by means of a fastening bolt (58) inserted in the vehicle width direction at a place overlapping with the left and right frame members (3, 3) in the side view of the motorcycle,
wherein the left and right brackets (53, 53) are respectively provided into one body with the cross member (50) with an interval in the vehicle width direction,
